intro: Lotus nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra lotus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking pink or purple blooms and is often found in rocky habitats. The plant has a distinctive palmate leaf structure, with leaves divided into several lobes. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, typical of its alpine and desert environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
